newsitem.title: MEXICO: Vitro gains after Anchor Glass news.
newsitem.headline: Vitro gains after Anchor Glass news.

text.p: Shares of Mexican glassmaker Vitro SA were higher in late trade following news it reached an agreement to sell assets from its troubled unit Anchor Glass Corp.
Vitro shares were up 4.94 percent to 17 pesos per share on the Mexican bourse while its ADRs had climbed 1/4 to $6-3/4.

Vitro said it had signed a tentative agreement to sell Anchor's assets to Ball-Foster Glass Container Co. To assure its continued operations until the sale, Anchor's board of directors voluntarily filed a petition for protection under Chapter 11 of the U.S. Bankruptcy Code, Vitro said.
"This should help Vitro because it eases its debt load," one dealer said.
Vitro had said last month it intended to sell Anchor and would focus on its core glass businesses, which it said were very profitable.
